etymologies: mid 17th century: from French cocarde, originally in bonnet à la coquarde, from the feminine of obsolete coquard ‘saucy’

definitions: a rosette or knot of ribbons worn in a hat as a badge of office or party, or as part of a livery

examples.text: the cap bore the traditional cockade in silver, blue, and red

shortDefinitions: rosette or knot of ribbons worn in hat as badge of office, or as part of livery
